doc.previous: The factor multiplying is the sine of angle of the incident ray with the x axis and the factor multiplying is the sine of angle of the refracted ray with the x axis Snell s law for refraction requires that these terms be equal As this calculation demonstrates Snell s law is equivalent to vanishing of the first variation of the optical path length
doc.after: Note that this integral is invariant with respect to changes in the parametric representation of C The Euler Lagrange equations for a minimizing curve have the symmetric form
